steps.step_name: Identify and instantiate ChemicalSynthesis per paper
steps.goal: Create a ChemicalSynthesis instance for each discrete, isolated product procedure reported in the paper and link it to the source document.

instances_to_create.description: One experimental procedure that yields exactly one isolated, identified product as reported in the paper.
instances_to_create.cardinality: multiple per paper; one per distinct final isolated product procedure

relations_to_establish.description: Link each ChemicalSynthesis to the source document entity representing the paper.

information_to_extract: Paper metadata: title, DOI, year (from whole paper; used to resolve/link bibo:Document)
Procedure anchors: section or heading identifiers to support later DocumentContext creation
Count of distinct isolated products and their procedure boundaries (Experimental/Synthesis sections)
constraints: Create ontosyn:ChemicalSynthesis only when the paper reports an identifiable, isolated, characterized product.
Do NOT create syntheses for commercial materials, stock solutions, non-isolated intermediates, conditioning steps, or analytical protocols.
Exactly one ontosyn:ChemicalSynthesis per isolated product; if multiple products are reported, instantiate multiple syntheses.
Link to an existing bibo:Document if available; otherwise create or reference a canonical document node outside this step.
Do NOT create any inputs, outputs, steps, yields, equipment, or DocumentContext in this step.

steps.goal: Instantiate the single ChemicalOutput and all ChemicalInput substances mentioned for each synthesis; attach them to the ChemicalSynthesis.

instances_to_create.description: The single isolated product for the ChemicalSynthesis (specific compound).
Reactants/reagents/catalysts intentionally added. Solvents are instantiated as ChemicalInput only if step-level additions will reference them (e.g., Dissolve/Separate/Filter).

relations_to_establish.description: Attach the single product to its synthesis.
Attach non-solvent inputs (reactants, reagents, catalysts). Solvents may be excluded here if only referenced at step-level.

information_to_extract: Product identifiers: name as written, codes/labels, empirical formula if explicitly stated (from Abstract/Experimental/Product characterization sections).
List of reagents/reactants/catalysts: names as written, roles if stated (from Experimental/Synthesis sections).
Solvents explicitly introduced for operations (e.g., dissolution, washing) to be instantiated if needed for step-level relations.
Disambiguation cues: CAS numbers, synonyms only if explicitly stated.
constraints: Exactly one ontosyn:ChemicalOutput per ontosyn:ChemicalSynthesis.
Include a substance as ontosyn:ChemicalInput only if explicitly part of the reaction/work-up; exclude atmospheres and equipment.
Do NOT infer solvent identities; instantiate a solvent as ChemicalInput only if explicitly named.
Do NOT link solvents via ontosyn:hasChemicalInput unless the paper treats them as reagents; otherwise reference them later via step-level properties.
Do not fabricate names/formulas; use verbatim text only.
Stop when all explicitly named products and inputs for this synthesis are created and linked.

steps.step_name: Construct ordered SynthesisSteps with vessels, atmospheres, and quantities
steps.goal: Instantiate every operational action as a SynthesisStep of the correct subtype, order them, and attach step-specific parameters, vessels, atmospheres, durations, and OM quantities.

instances_to_create.description: Generic container for ordered operational steps in a synthesis (will be instantiated via concrete subclasses).
Introduce ONE new material to the mixture per step.
instances_to_create.cardinality: multiple per synthesis; one per added material

instances_to_create.description: Stirring step explicitly stated as such.
Heating or cooling, including cooling to room temperature.
Evaporation under heat or reduced pressure.
Ultrasonic treatment step.
Dissolving solids in a solvent.
Crystallization operation.
Material transfer between vessels.
Physical separation (e.g., phase separation, decantation).
Filtration step.
Drying step for materials or solids.
Physical container used in a step (verbatim descriptors, e.g., 'Teflon-lined SS autoclave, 23 mL').
instances_to_create.cardinality: multiple; one per step if stated

instances_to_create.description: Vessel type taxonomy linked from a Vessel.
instances_to_create.cardinality: as needed when the paper names specific types

instances_to_create.description: Atmosphere for a vessel during a step (e.g., N2, Ar, air, vacuum).
Specific separation technique linked from a Separate step.
instances_to_create.cardinality: as needed when a technique is explicitly named

instances_to_create.description: Temperature values as written for relevant steps.
Pressure values as written for relevant steps.
Volumes for transfers, evaporated-to, vessels if given.
Step durations as written.
Heating/cooling rate as written.

relations_to_establish.description: Attach each step to its parent synthesis.
Order index starting at 1 and increasing by 1 with no gaps.
Vessel used in the step.
Type classification of the vessel, if provided.
Atmosphere for the step (e.g., N2, Ar, vacuum).
Duration as written.
Keyâ€“value parameters explicitly stated for the step (free text).
The single material introduced in this Add step.
Target pH when the paper explicitly states it.
Layering mode for addition if explicitly stated.
Whether the mixture was stirred during addition, if explicitly stated.
Temperature during stirring if given.
Mark as waiting (no stirring) if explicitly stated.
Target temperature (including 'room temperature' as written).
Ramp rate if provided.
Whether the vessel was under vacuum during Heat/Chill.
Whether the vessel was sealed (autoclave/closed system).
Whether stirring occurred during Heat/Chill, if stated.
Evaporation pressure as written.
Evaporation temperature as written.
Final volume after evaporation if given.
Volatile component(s) removed if explicitly identified.
Solvent used to dissolve materials.
Crystallization temperature as written.
Transferred volume if given.
Layered transfer if stated.
Destination vessel for the transfer.
Technique used for separation (e.g., decantation, phase separation).
Solvent involved in the separation if specified.
Washing solvent used during filtration.
Mark as vacuum filtration if stated.
Number of times filtration is repeated (1 if not repeated).
Drying agent if specified.
Drying pressure as written.
Drying temperature as written.

information_to_extract: Explicit operations and their order (from Experimental/Procedure subsections).
Step types matching ontology (Add, Stir, HeatChill, Evaporate, Sonicate, Dissolve, Crystallize, Transfer, Separate, Filter, Dry).
Per-step vessel description verbatim (material, volume) and vessel environment (atmosphere).
Per-step durations, target temperatures, pressures, rates, volumes as written (do not normalize units beyond OM representation).
For Add: single material per step, target pH, stirring during addition, layered additions if stated.
For Evaporate: temperature, pressure, final volume, removed species.
For Separate/Filter/Dissolve: the solvents involved.
For HeatChill: temperature targets, ramp rates, sealed/vacuum/stirred flags.
Transfer: destination vessels and volumes.
constraints: Step order must start at 1 and increment by 1 with no gaps per synthesis.
Do NOT create generic steps (e.g., 'work up'); map only to allowed step classes.
Create exactly one ontosyn:Add per added material; do not bundle multiple materials in one Add.
Use verbatim vessel wording; classify VesselType if type is explicitly stated.
Only create VesselEnvironment for atmospheric contexts (N2, Ar, air, vacuum).
Use OM quantity instances only when values are explicitly reported; do not infer or compute missing values.
Solvents referenced here must be instantiated as ontosyn:ChemicalInput if they appear in step-level relations, regardless of synthesis-level hasChemicalInput linkage.
Stop when all steps in the procedure text are represented and ordered, and all explicit step-level parameters are captured.

steps.step_name: Model process equipment at step level
steps.goal: Instantiate process equipment and link it to steps via usesEquipment, and model HeatChill-specific devices; capture rotary evaporator flags.

instances_to_create.description: Process equipment explicitly used during synthesis (e.g., autoclave, oven, ultrasonic bath, centrifuge, vacuum line). Exclude analytical instruments.
Specific device controlling temperature (e.g., oil bath, ice bath, heating mantle) when explicitly mentioned.

relations_to_establish.description: Link each step to process equipment used, excluding analytical instruments.
Attach the specific temperature-control device when stated.
Record device settings if expressed only as text (e.g., 'ultrasonicated at 40 kHz').
Mark true if a rotary evaporator is explicitly stated; otherwise false/omitted.

information_to_extract: Process equipment mentions per step: autoclaves, ovens, ultrasonic baths, centrifuges, vacuum lines (exclude NMR/IR/PXRD).
Heat/Chill device names (e.g., 'oil bath', 'ice bath').
Rotary evaporator usage statements.
Any step-level device settings described only narratively.
constraints: Only create ontosyn:Equipment for process equipment; do NOT include analytical instruments.
Deduplicate equipment within a synthesis: reuse the same Equipment node for repeated identical mentions.
If a device name could be either vessel or equipment (e.g., 'autoclave'), model as ontosyn:Equipment; vessels are handled separately via ontosyn:Vessel.
usesEquipment applies to SynthesisStep (or synthesis globally in next step); do not link Vessel via usesEquipment.
Stop when all equipment explicitly tied to steps are linked; unknown or implied equipment must be omitted.

steps.step_name: Attach global equipment, yields, document context, suppliers, and chemical metadata
steps.goal: Complete remaining synthesis-level properties: global equipment, yield, document context, procedure inheritance, supplier and material provenance, and chemical descriptors.

instances_to_create.description: Yield value (e.g., percent) as written for the ChemicalSynthesis output.
instances_to_create.cardinality: zero or one per synthesis (only if explicitly reported)

instances_to_create.description: In-document anchor (section/subsection/paragraph identifiers) for the procedure.
instances_to_create.cardinality: one per synthesis when a distinct anchor is identifiable

instances_to_create.description: Supplier entities for inputs only when explicitly mentioned.
Global process equipment used across the synthesis when the paper states equipment without per-step specificity.
Conceptual class for yield notes/qualifiers (present but not linked by properties in current T-Box; do not instantiate unless a linking property is introduced).
instances_to_create.cardinality: none by default in current schema

instances_to_create.description: Reserved class for future execution anchors; not linked by any property in current T-Box.
instances_to_create.cardinality: none by default in current schema

relations_to_establish.description: Attach explicit yield value for this synthesis only (do not compute; do not inherit).
Link synthesis to its in-document anchor (section/paragraph identifiers).

Link to another ChemicalSynthesis in the same paper when text states 'same as/according to/similar to'; inputs and steps are inherited by default; exceptions parsed from text; yields are NOT inherited.
Add supplier only if explicitly named in the paper.
Link to a canonical material entity if resolvable; otherwise omit.
Global equipment associated with the synthesis; can include ontosyn:Equipment, ontosyn:Vessel, or ontosyn:HeatChillDevice instances as applicable.
Link to a MetalOrganicPolyhedron when the specific MOP instance is identifiable in the knowledge base.
Reported purity for inputs (verbatim).
Any explicit aliases/codes provided in the paper.
Chemical formula as written.
Detailed input description if stated (e.g., hydrated form, hazard notes).

information_to_extract: Yield values and qualifiers (e.g., 'isolated yield 78%', 'crystalline yield'), strictly as written; do not compute (from Results/Experimental/Product sections).
Global equipment mentions not tied to specific steps (from Experimental/General methods).
Document anchors: section titles, subsection labels, paragraph numbers for each procedure.
Inheritance language: 'same as', 'following', 'according to', with explicit exceptions (replace/instead of/without/increase/decrease) within the same paper only.
Suppliers for inputs when explicitly named (e.g., Sigma-Aldrich).
Input metadata: purity, aliases/codes, formulas, and descriptive qualifiers.
Resolvable links for ChemicalOutput to known MetalOrganicPolyhedron instances (if referenced).
constraints: Yield cardinality: at most one ontosyn:hasYield per synthesis; only if explicitly reported; do not compute from masses/moles.
Do NOT inherit yields via ontosyn:inheritsFromProcedure; only inherit inputs and steps with explicit exceptions applied.
ontolab:LabEquipment linked via ontosyn:hasEquipment must be process equipment; exclude analytical instruments.
Deduplicate Supplier and Equipment nodes across the paper by exact-match on normalized names; reuse existing instances when possible.
Only create ontosyn:Supplier when explicitly stated; otherwise omit isSuppliedBy.
Only create ontosyn:DocumentContext when a specific section/paragraph anchor is identifiable; use verbatim labels.
Only set ontosyn:isRepresentedBy when a resolvable MOP instance exists; otherwise omit.
Do not instantiate ontosyn:Yield or ontosyn:ExecutionPoint unless future linking properties are available; keep schema compliance.
Stop when each synthesis has (if available) a yield, document context, any global equipment, supplier links for inputs, and chemical metadata populated.
